meanings.definition: To release or open a buckle.
meanings.sent1: She unbuckles her seatbelt before getting out of the car.
meanings.sent2: He always unbuckles his helmet after a bike ride.
meanings.sent3: The magician unbuckles the handcuffs to free himself from the chains.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the sky seems to unbuckle its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unbuckles the leash to let the dog run free.

meanings.sent1: Before bed, she unbuckles her shoes to relax.
meanings.sent2: He carefully unbuckles the belt on his backpack to access his snacks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel unbuckles the latch on the bird feeder for an unexpected feast.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seems to unbuckle the roof tiles one by one.
meanings.sent5: With a gentle tug, she unbuckles the clasp of the necklace to take it off.

meanings.sent1: He quickly unbuckles the strap of his watch to check the time.
meanings.sent2: She unbuckles the baby's bib after a messy meal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon unbuckles the picnic basket to steal the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: The laughter in the room seems to unbuckle any tension that was present.
meanings.sent5: With a sigh of relief, she unbuckles the heavy backpack after a long hike.
